txt.en: Talk to Ravaedron
Talk to Ravaedron outside Fernbrake Cot
Fight alongside Himeinior in defence of Ravaedron
Knock on the door to Fernbrake Cot
Weather the storm of the Stagshorns' displeasure with Ravaedron
Himeinior has agreed to help Ravaedron with his latest scheme, and is waiting to speak with you.
'He's in for it now!'
'Aye, that's true! And I would have it no other way!'
DNT - Blah!
'I liked the other one better.'
'I jest! I jest!'
'Did Ravaedron tell you how long this would take? Because he gave me no indication, and this is not the only task I have set before me today!\n\n'Let us hope this takes minutes and not hours.'
You have come with Ravaedron to Fernbrake Cot.
'Wait... Orcs? Wargs?'
Ravaedron has come up with another scheme he hopes will make things right with the Stagshorns.
'You should have painted those!'
'Our next destination is Fernbrake Cot, [placeholder]. With your help I will set this right.'
Ravaedron has asked you to knock on the door to Fernbrake Cot.
DNT - Blah!
'I needs must prepare, [placeholder]. You knock on the door while I make ready.'
'I will give that Elf a piece of my mind!'
'No! You listen to me, Ravaedron!'
'We are not so long-lived as you, but we are not children.'
Ravaedron has invited you and the Stagshorns to follow him around the side of Fernbrake Cot.
'We did not befriend you so we would be made safe in the Angle.'
'We did not want paintings, or gifts!'
'It is YOU that we will miss, Ravaedron.'
'You must be the most thick-headed of all your people!'
Ravaedron has finished whatever he was doing, and is now ready to thank you for your help.
'It is beautiful, Ravaedron.'
'It will brighten the room for all who look upon it, and warm their hearts.'
You have drawn the unenviable task of weathering the storm of the Stagshorns' displeasure with Ravaedron.
'Wargs!'
'Still holding up, [placeholder]?'
'This had better be worth it!'
'Orcs? What could be next?'
'Ah, it was nothing, Ravaedron. The merest exercise!'
'[placeholder]? What is it?'
'You have come back with Ravaedron?'
'If anything, you have set an example of danger for Bran.'
'We cannot pretend to understand what you have endured, my friend.'
'But we will not try to make you stay.'
'Another? You must be joking!'
'You have outdone yourself, my friend.'
'It shall hang by the fireplace in Fernbrake Cot from now on, Ravaedron.'
'That's my Bran!'
'Thank you, my friends.'
'And my thanks go to [placeholder] and the Rangers of Tornhad as well!'
Follow Ravaedron
Ravaedron has returned from his task
'I could have painted nothing of worth while under threat from Orc and warg!'
'I have completed my task, Himeinior, and I thank you both for protecting me!'
Himeinior has been defeated, and you have failed!
'My friends. If you will hear my words...'
'Well... I have made you another painting.'
'Come with me, my friends.'
'My first gift to you was just a painting, but this one is something more.'
'It reflects what I will truly miss:'
'Quiet afternoons in Fernbrake Cot with my dearest friends.'
'Keep it, or not. But the memory of those days brings a smile to my face.'
'Perhaps it will do the same for you?'
Instance: The Lasting Friendship
Talk to Himeinior
